Both are wonderful Disney films that I think you would truly appreciate!

Based on your preference for Disney films and tales of adventure, I'd recommend "The Yearling" and "The Sword in the Stone".

"The Yearling" is a heartwarming story about a boy's bond with a young deer and the challenges that come with it, starring Forrest Tucker, Jane Wyman, and June Lockhart.

"The Sword in the Stone," while not the animated version you might be familiar with, is an earlier adaptation of the story where a poor boy named Arthur learns valuable lessons on love, kindness, knowledge, and bravery with Merlin's guidance.

I'd be happy to help! If you're looking for something different from your previous choices, I'd recommend "Ratatouille" (2007). This heartwarming animated film follows a rat with an exceptional palate who teams up with a young kitchen worker at a famous Paris restaurant. The voice cast is fantastic, featuring stars like Patton Oswalt and Brad Garrett!

If you're interested in another unique take on a classic tale, "Cinder" (2012) might be just the movie for you. It offers a modern twist on Cinderella set in a dark post-modern underworld. The film features an impressive cast and presents love as a beacon of hope amidst deceit and greed. Enjoy exploring these new worlds!

I'd highly recommend "The Princess and the Frog"! This charming animated film from Disney follows a waitress named Tiana on her journey to turn a frog prince into a human. It features voice talents like Anika Noni Rose, Oprah Winfrey, and John Goodman. The film's beautiful animation and heartwarming story make it a must-watch for both kids and adults alike.

If you're looking for something a bit more suspenseful, "The Shaggy Dog" might be right up your alley! Starring Robert Downey Jr., this comedic adventure tells the story of a man who turns into a sheepdog and has to navigate his new form while maintaining a normal life. It's a fun twist on the classic tale that's sure to provide plenty of laughs. Enjoy your movie-watching experience!

While "The Princess and the Frog" is a modern tale set in the jazz era of New Orleans, "The Sword in the Stone" transports you to medieval England with a young Arthur learning valuable lessons under Merlin's guidance. I highly recommend giving "The Sword in the Stone" a try if you enjoy historical fantasy and character development. Enjoy your movie time!

I'd highly recommend watching "We the Living" and "Taxi Driver".

"We the Living" is a gripping drama set against the backdrop of the Russian Revolution, offering an intriguing exploration of individualism versus collectivism.

"Taxi Driver", on the other hand, delves into the complex psyche of a taxi driver in New York City who becomes embroiled in the city's gritty underworld, featuring memorable performances by Robert De Niro and Jodie Foster. Both films are thought-provoking and will surely captivate you!
